history.text: sups
HELLO
There is a lot of slapstick humor in this movie.
what did you think about the movie?
I think it was a funny movie when I was a kid
I laughed my ass off when I was like 10 years old
Me too. Macaulay Culkin was perfect in this role.
I still don't understand how you could leave a kid behind, but oh well!
I think I saw another movie features this little kid a while ago, it was like his parents being forced to open a vault inside a mountain or something
Hmm interesting! I don't think I've seen that one, but it can't be as popular as this movie was.
It's funny this movie didn't get great reviews, but it made a ton of money!
this one's definitely deserved love from 90s, you know the feeling that when you are a kid, and you somehow simply resonate with a movie like this, same goes with harry porter
I don't give two f**k about those critics review, you love a movie when you love a movie, and that's that

yeah this is definitely one of those movies that takes you back. I forgot that this is supposed to happen outside of Chicago and I forgot how good the other actors were. Yeah critics do suck pretty bad!
that's their job, they'd judge everything inside a movie, when it's simply joyful to lay back and enjoy a show
exactly! they spend every freaking moment trying to critique the movie instead of grabbing some popcorn and a drink to enjoy it!
Man I miss Joe Pesci being in movies!!!
but anyway, box office don't lie, when it's selling well, it only means that people love it, who cares about critics, haha
you are so right..Money always moves the needle!
I think the last time I saw this movie was more than 10 years ago, damn
Yeah it's been a minute for me too! As I'm reading these scenes, some of this stuff I forgot happened!
yeah, before reading those details, I only remember how the kids set up the booby traps and mess with those 2 burglars
Lol! Yeah I definitely don't remember the details. I don't even remember the mom getting back to Scranton, PA.
I mean a traveling Polka Band! I don't remember that at all!
umm, I think the Polka Band tingles my memory a little, maybe it's still in my subconsciousness!
Dang, you are better than me! I just remember the kids facial expressions and his constant ability to thwart the bungling thieves.
do you remember the scene where Kevin went to central park or something and met with a homeless guy feeding his birds maybe
Sounds slightly familiar...Some guy that was giving him advice right?
sounds right
Is that this Marley character that this scene is talking about?
not sure if it's homealone 1 or 2, what's the odd that he got left behind twice, lol
wait, it's in chicago, so not central park, could be millenial park
yeah exactly! But like you said earlier, the first one made so much money, you knew they were going to do another.
You could be right about the park
do you remember another family movie where a dad is dragging his family to Europe
for vacation, and it's hilarious
is that the national lampoon's movies?
oh yes
those are awesome...especially the original ones with Chevy Chase
totally classic
I'm surprised they haven't tried to do a remake with this movie with some new actors...
back in 90s things are simpler, nowadays making a movie without offending something, or something is very difficult
people are becoming overly sensitive
I agree with you wholeheartedly. The PC crowd has taken over and now people are offended when you breathe....
true, good for us, we have those old classic movie for a genuine laugh
The sequel of this movie should have had Child Protection Services take Macaulay out of the home!...Lol! You're right about the classics!
as ridiculous as it may sound, they made 3 not 2!!
the third one bit of lame though, don't remember it at all
wow it didn't even know they made a third! Yikes, I bet it was pretty bad!
typical Hollywood strategy, keep making sequel until it starts to rot
Exactly! Drain the sequels until you have squeezed out the last dollar

uid2response.feedback: This was a lot of fun to participate in.
